ygData.subject: Re: Camping, a solution
ygData.msgSnippet: You do of course realize that there would be no way to hunt for the particular item you are looking for, right?  ie, a 35th lvl item, one that a 35th lvl
ygData.messageBody:
You do of course realize that there would be no way to hunt for the particular item you are looking for, right? ie, a 35th lvl item, one that a 35th lvl monster drops, ie rubicite bracers. So lets concider where all you would have to go to look for this item

Karanas- could be any of the griffins or giants
oasis-could be one of the spectres or giants
s ro-could be on one of the giants
e commons-could be on a griffin
w commons-could be on a giant or griffin
cazic thule-could be on any number of monsters there
mistmoore-could be on any number of monsters there
soulsekB-could be on any number of monsters there
befallen-it could conceivably spawn on commander windstream

so would it make since to go to all these places to look for a particular item, or would you just find a pretty safe place to camp and wait to see what item spawned on one of the creatures that you are camping? I would think your odds of finding "random" items like this would be equal if you camped one spot, or if you traveled to various zones. Doesn't seem like this would promote adventuring. And it would take FOREVER to actually get an item you want.

>>> "Jynxx" <Jynxx@...> 5.25.99 3:11:43 PM >>>
From: "Jynxx" <Jynxx@...>

YES!!!!!!!!!!!!!
That's what we need! A random item spawn.....I'll even take it one step
further:
Lets say that said sword is on a level 45 person...so we'll call that a
'level 45 item' it can then spawn to any level 45+ NPC in all of the zone,
or even norrath. That would make people have to travel A LOT to find items
they want, and would completely prevent camping for items altogether. That
way if you really wanted an item bad enough, your group had to go search for
it...not just sit sround and wait for it....that to me is not even
role-playing.
Just my 2 cents.

Tyveris
